intro: Tagetes multiseta, commonly known as the multiset marigold, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Tagetes multiseta is also known for its ability to repel certain pests, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
